instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power/liquid damage
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that was liquid damaged.  Will not start up. Green light on the charger. Replaced <CAPACITOR>C4691</CAPACITOR> due to it being burned. Cleaned in ultransonic tank and reassembled.  Still a green light on the charger but will not power on.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
Pin 14 2.33v
Pin 19 0v
Pin 20 0v
Pin 12 3.42v


Changed <RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR> 4.7k due to short


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> AT <CAPACITOR>C4260</CAPACITOR> 1.75v

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER3V3_ISNS</SIGNAL> AT <CAPACITOR>C7525</CAPACITOR> 1.75v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> AT <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> 1.84v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> AT <RESISTOR>R5091</RESISTOR> 3.42V stable

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> AT <CAPACITOR>C2230</CAPACITOR> 3.42 stable

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> AT <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> Pin 14  0v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> AT L5801 0V

PP3v3 0v at <CAPACITOR>C7721</CAPACITOR>

I'm confused about <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> and how it's powered by PP5V and at the same time it's the chip that generates it. How does that work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power/liquid damage
threads.message: PPBUS is missing so that is where everything stops. Checked stuff around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, pins 17/18, 27/28 resistance? Short on PPBUS?
